Articles.Content:
Hello everyone!

After a lot of corrections, I'm finally glad to show you my version of Orion spacecraft with Delta-IV launch vehicle.

I even don't know what to say more (and don't want to make you wait), so lets see it!

Delta-IV - Orion

Javascript is disabled. View full album

How to use it :

How to orbit:

1. !!! Click RMB on the Orion docking port and then click "Control from here"

2. Activate SAS (press "T") and set thrust to 100% (press "Z")

3. Press "Space" to activate engines

4. Press "Space" one more time to release clamps

5. Gravity turn at 23 km (turn to 45 degrees)

6. After separating boosters turn to 0 degrees to horizon

7. Separate fairings at more than 60 km

8. Aim for around 130 km apogee

8. Separate the empty 1st stage and fairings of the 2nd stage

9. Activate engine of the 2nd stage and circulize the orbit

10. After reaching the orbit separate the 2nd stage and deploy solar panels

How to deorbit:

1. Turn to retrograde

2. Activate engines

3. Detach service module at 70 km

4. Deploy chutes at 15 km

Craft characteristics:

Part count:

- Delta-IV - 624

- Orion - 220

- total - 844

Mass, t:

- Delta-IV - 393,2

- Orion - 24,6

- total - 417,8

Hotkeys (Orion):

1 - toggle 1xLV-T30

2 - toggle 8xLV-1R

3 - toggle 4xsolar panels

4 - deploy chutes

9 - detach nose fairing

Abort - activate LES

Here you can download this craft - >>click<<!

Thank you for your attention! Hope you like this craft!

Edited December 28, 2014 by Nik_601

Masterpiece!! But it does take off really slow..... and it's kind of whobly

But looking at it in the VAB is much fun anyway

Gue

The Orion had a LES, and it's kinda wobbly, but the Orion itself is beautiful! Especially the Command Module!

Here, have some +rep!

It's kinda wobbly, but really, really cool
